Text:
The Shadow Garden's soldiers are training as usual
under their instructor's harsh cries.

No. 666! What was that pathetic fight just now?!
Slacking off just because it's a training exercise?!
N-No, it's not like that!

Don't talk back to me! Small fry like you have no
right to voice an opinion!
Yes, ma'am! My apologies!

If this were a battlefield, you'd be the first to
die a pathetic, meaningless death!
Urgh... Please, allow me to fight once again!

...Hmph. Very well. Anyone who's available,
take on No. 666.
We'll now begin combat training in teams!

See that ribbon I've placed there? Your unit loses
if the other unit takes it or if they wipe you out.

Alright, all of you, get ready to fight!
...Begin!

(Earlier, I was too defensive and missed my chance
to counterattack... This time, I'll launch the offensive.)

(Their weak link seems to be the girl on the right.
If I target her...)
...Fool.
*huff, huff*

(It was a struggle, but I defeated her. I was given
a chance, and I didn't waste—)

...No. 666, what the hell were you thinking charging
to the right?
Huh?

Were this a battlefield, what would've happened to
the two you left behind?
Th-They...would've been on their own...

That's right! Your selfish actions would've placed
them both in danger! Is your brain incapable of
conceiving such thoughts?!
M-My apologies!

The same goes for you two! If No. 666 acts on her own,
respond flexibly! Advance with her instead of standing
around confused!

That was dismal fighting from the three of you.
Go run laps until I tell you to stop!

P-Please wait! It was my selfish actions that were
at fault! I'm responsible—

No. 666. How many times must I tell you not to talk
back to me?

You aren't at a level where you can be speaking about
responsibility. Now get running!

(I feel awful for the other two... They're only in
this situation because of me.)

(I've got to get used to fighting as a team, instead
of on my own...)

Thus, No. 666 consciously strives to fight as a team
in her training. However...
Agh...ughh! *cough, cough*

I take you on myself, and this is the pathetic
result? No. 666...
Ulp... Y-Yes, ma'am...

What's with your clumsy moves? You seemed to be
slacking off.

I wasn't slacking off, ma'am! I was prioritizing
teamwork to maintain our unit's formation!

You call that teamwork? What a joke! Is your head
full of nonsense?

Rodents have a better grasp of teamwork than you!
With such an empty, useless brain, you're better off
without one!
...My apologies, ma'am.

(I've made a conscious effort, yet I've failed to
convey any of it...)

(I can't fight like it's a solo battle, but I can't
match the pace of my teammates either...
What am I supposed to do?

Don't give me that look. If you don't like it here,
then leave. You can run away wherever you want.

(Run away? After leaving everything behind to
become a member of the Shadow Garden?)

(...No. I'm here for a reason. Giving up and running
away is not an option!)

...I'm sorry, ma'am. I don't seem to understand
teamwork!
Why you little—

That's why I'd like to ask you for your time! Please
teach me what it means to be a team in the Shadow
Garden!

...You've got guts, I'll give you that. Did you
anticipate this, or is it an act of desperation?

Very well. I'll work you extra hard until you grasp
what it means to be a team.
...Besides, "he" also asked me to look after you.
Thank you!
Hmph. Nu, come here!
...I'm here.

You came to watch the training, didn't you?
You heard what we just discussed?

Roughly. We need to drill the concept of teamwork
into No. 666, right?

That's right. You, No. 666, and I will fight together
against all the soldiers here.
Very well.
A-Against everyone here?!
Scared? You can still turn tail—
...No. I'll do my best!

...I see. Let me say this first, No. 666. You've yet
to reach a level where you can speak about
responsibility. So what's your reason to fight
alongside your comrades?
My reason... What do you mean?

That's what you're training to find out. Now prepare
yourself.
U-Understood!

...There's about a quarter of them left. What's the
matter? Giving up already?
*pant, pant* H-Hardly!

(If I'm being honest, I'm close to my limits...but I
think I'm starting to understand a little.)

(What motivates them isn't a sense of responsibility
or obligation toward their friends. It must be...)
It must be...their belief...
Looks like she passed out.
...Let her sleep.

Hmph. Pathetic. She has a long way to go regarding
both stamina and technique.

But she seemed to be getting a feel for it towards
the end. She was gradually shifting away from her
desperation to not hold us back...

I guess she's begun to realize what it means to fight
alongside others, if only at the shallowest level.
She'll likely get rattled in actual combat, and all
her bad habits will reemerge.

But...we'll leave it here for today. I must report
this to Lady Alpha.

Lambda turns her gaze to the slumbering No. 666,
whose expression carries a faint trace of relief.
